title: .:en:Extend trade.models with Exchange.
body:
.:en
Add the **trade.Exchange** model, to enable atomic exchange of assets between identities, identities being **users.User**, and assets being things registered as **meta.Instances**, which may be created at the time of operation, if necessary to identify some divisible quantity, like liters of water, or amounts of money .

Each **Exchange** would involve equivalent exchange of hour-money.

So, an **Exchange** would credit one account, and debit another account.

title: .:en:Change the ID to UUID.
body:
.:en
It would make sense, especially useful in merging databases.

title: .:lt:Pasidaryti vietinę infinity, kurioje yra tik įmonės, kadangi:
body:
.:lt
Infinity yra labiau kūrybai skirtas projektas, ir jei dabar imčiau dideliais kiekiais importuoti egzistuojančius projektus, tai pranyktų mūsų diskusija. :)

Tačiau infinity modelis tinka analizuoti įmonėms, ir būtų geras demo kitam susitikimui.

title: .:lt:Pritaikyti turimom įmonėm suprasti, ir kaip Infinity modelio demo.
body:
.:lt
Kadangi turime įmonių duomenų bazę, tai importuoti įmones kaip projektus, ir padaryti joms tokias apklausas apie [idea] ir [step].

Kiekvienas gyvybingas projektas dažniausiai turi tam tikrus finansinius srautus, kurie atsiranda iš to, kad yra kažkas gaunama ir sukuriama ir parduodama. Tai yra paprasčiausia "pirkimų/gamybos/pardavimų" idėja. Tai, kas iš ko yra sukuriama apibrėžia, kokią funkciją įmonė atlieka. Norėdami suprasti tą funkciją, turime suprasti įmonės koordinavimosi (programą), kurią galima suprasti naudojantis Infinity modeliu, ir darant tam tikrą apklausą, pradedant dviem klausimais:

**1) Kokiomis idėjomis jos yra paremtos.**

Labai daug įmonių bus paremtos tiesiog pirkimo/transporto/pardavimo idėja, ir kainų skirtumu, tad jas galima būtų ten ir kategorizuoti. Tačiau tos, kurios kažką gamina, bus paremtos jau produkto idėja. Pvz., kokia nors AirBus ar Boeing įmonė, yra paremtos "Lėktuvo" idėja, bet taip pat "Skrydžių komercijalizacijos" idėja. Klausimas apklausai galėtų atrodyti taip.

Pvz., kokosų pieną importuojant įmonė yra paremta "prekybos" idėja. Pvz., kokosų pieną sukurianti įmonė bus paremta "auginimo ir surinkimo" idėja. Pvz., kokosų pieną pakuojanti įmonė bus paremta "pakavimo, išpilstymo ir konservavimo" idėjomis. Nors šios idėjos svarbios, jos gali būti lengvai atsakytos tiesiog pateikiant įmonės kategorija. Kas mums iš tiesų įdomu, yra paties "kokosų pieno kaip gėrimo idėja" (pvz., tuomet, kai dar nebuvo žinoma, kad kokosų pienas yra valgomas ir skanus). Tad rašome "kokosų pienas, kaip gėrimas" -- kaip inovatyvią idėja, ir visas įmones jungiame šia idėja "kokosų pieno kaip gėrimo" idėja.

**2) Kokius management'o board'us jos turi.**

Pvz., kokia nors kokosų pieną parduodanti įmonė gali turėti keletą komunikacijos gupių ("boards"), kuriose koordinuoja skirtingo tipo veiklą, kaip kad, pvz., valstybė turi skirtingus departamentus. Kokie yra įmonės departamentai, apsprendžia jos aukščiausio lygio "Steps" ("Etapus").

Pvz., software-development projektai, kaip kad Infinity, turi tokius board'us:

![ " \"tokius\""](https://wiki.mindey.com/shared/shots/3928cacfec9e8e3eb2b43c95a.png) board'us.

Aišku, kiekvienas iš board'ų turės sub-komunikacijos kanalų, žmonių, ir t.t., tačiau tai jau galėtume analizuoti vėlesniais etapais.

​

​

​

​

title: .:en:Goals Pursuit Measurement
body:
.:en
Each goal that we set, is essentially economic, because in order to achieve it, we need the time of people and machines. The **ideas** created and **plans** ("companies/projects") executed towards the achievement of **goals** may be said to be a type of KPIs for goal pursuit.

In fact, the specific **assets** (such as products that appear on markets) are a derivative result of these ideas and plans. The economic input to execute these ideas and plans are human and machine execution time. The economic output is the other types of assets -- derivatives of that time. All types of assets are traded on various places (from social media -- human assets, to e-shops -- commodities, to stock markets -- projects, and all other kinds.) They are de-facto traded in all kind of currencies, which are not themselves valuable, but rather, just help determine the price, as a result of supply-and-demand driven exchange.

So, a problem is this -- suppose we have a trade (some market), and assets already have acquired some equilibrium prices. What does that say about the **goals** of the market participants? Since our Goals can be expressed in terms of ranges for amounts or qualities of assets that we pursuit to have, the markets can tell us about the estimates of **goals** of all of their participants.

However, suppose we have data about trade of participants of all markets. This trade occurs in various currencies. How do we define a measure, that normalizes the value to some physical unit (i.e., non-monetary unit -- machine/human time and energy) to measure what's physically needed to produce those asset flows that the world needs, and have relative value of different types of times (e.g., true statistical value of different times of different types of machines and different types of humans)?

And, more interestingly, since human combination with a machine may be producing another machine of greater value, it would be interesting to see, what combination chains tend to multiply the physical spending on time (for example, the spending of machine time to do X vs Y product, or human time spent to do X vs Y). Ability to measure and recommend at this level could potentially greatly increase our ability to solve problems and pursue goals..:lt
Each goal that we set requires the time of people and machines to achieve. The **ideas** created and **plans** ("companies/projects") executed towards the achievement of **goals** may be said to be a type of KPIs for goal pursuit.

In fact, the specific **assets** (such as products that appear on markets) are a derivative result of these ideas and plans. The economic input to execute these ideas and plans are human and machine execution time. The economic output is the other types of assets -- derivatives of that time. All types of assets are traded on various places (from social media -- human assets, to e-shops -- commodities, to stock markets -- projects, and all other kinds.) They are de-facto traded in all kind of currencies, which are not themselves valuable, but rather, just help determine the price, as a result of supply-and-demand driven exchange.

So, a problem is this -- suppose we have a trade (some market), and assets already have acquired some equilibrium prices. What does that say about the **goals** of the market participants? Since our Goals can be expressed in terms of ranges for amounts or qualities of assets that we pursuit to have, the markets can tell us about the estimates of **goals** of all of their participants.

However, suppose we have data about trade of participants of all markets. This trade occurs in various currencies. How do we define a measure, that normalizes the value to some physical unit (i.e., non-monetary unit -- machine/human time and energy) to measure what's physically needed to produce those asset flows that the world needs, and have relative value of different types of times (e.g., true statistical value of different times of different types of machines and different types of humans)?

And, more interestingly, since human combination with a machine may be producing another machine of greater value, it would be interesting to see, what combination chains tend to multiply the physical spending on time (for example, the spending of machine time to do X vs Y product, or human time spent to do X vs Y). Ability to measure and recommend at this level could potentially greatly increase our ability to solve problems and pursue goals.

title: .:en:Fix and enable search.
body:
.:en
Since it is quite important to enable lookups for topics that already exist, to avoid repeating oneself.

title: .:en:Multilingual topics not always switching.
body:
.:en
[https://infty.xyz/#/cn/@/split/topic/18](https://infty.xyz/#/cn/@/split/topic/18) -- example, of multilingual topic. So, it should switch upon clicking. However, when visiting by clicking from index, it does not switch by clicking language version links on its content.

title: .:en:Ambulance Arrival Time Maps and Testing
body:
.:en
So, since it is know that human brain begins dies in 5 minutes without oxygen, the timing of emergency help, and ambulance is critical to increasing survival rates. Not a new idea. The UK has been controlling for arrival times for a long time, and there are such maps ([http://www.ambulanceresponsetimes.co.uk/](http://www.ambulanceresponsetimes.co.uk/)) , but it would be important globally, and may help people at risk to decide where to live.

The response times are so important, that it would make sense to control for that with tests like in software development.

title: .:en:Fix language switching flukes.
body:
.:en
- [ ] Language switching not always switches the interface language.

- [ ] Language "show only" button is not always matching the state of the localStorage variable.

title: .:en:Loader to indicate long-saving comments?
body:
.:en
Right now, since comment is a complex thing. (in theory, it's equivalent to the concept of "operation"), it may take some time to save it. Therefore, it may make sense to have loader (progress) for saving comments action,

body:
.:en
It looks like comments not always order properly. Do it this evening.

title: .:en:Trying to understand
body:
.:en
How does it work?

title: .:en:Make notifications to all users about new top-level goals, ideas to solve them, and new plans.
body:
.:en
This task is basically to create a really good notifier. Potentially -- with some help from experience of mailer.lt guys, or designers, so that nice HTML e-mails are sent to the users. It could work like currently Telegram notification bot works. (test quality first with that)

title: .:en:Add subscribe button to topics.
body:
.:en
So the readers can get notified, even if not commented. (right now, by default only topic author and commenters get notifications)

title: .:en:Document MFT package and show examples to make it more useful.
body:
.:en
The MFT package is already useful today, and may be useful for many people, if it were better known. So, it would be good to document it at least.

title: .:en:MFT-1 implementation
body:
.:en
MFT-1 implementation, is a project to do data-preparation, data-normalization, schema-alignment and data-alignment. It implements normalization rules, that are part of [MFT-1](https://book.mindey.com/metaformat/0002-data-object-format/0002-data-object-format.html) (Metaformat-1) specification.

Metaform on GitHub:

[https://github.com/wefindx/metaform](https://github.com/wefindx/metaform)

title: .:en:Well, let's add a few items in the market.
body:
.:en
Just for demo.

title: .:en:Integrate infinity with Jira.
body:
.:en
Steps can work like boards, also substeps can work like sprints. One of the substeps can be a backlog. Tasks are in those steps. We can have easily unlimited nesting.

title: .:en:Make it possible to download contribution records to project, as an excel.
body:
.:en
That would help analyze them, I suppose. Or maybe, we could just have nice visualization of contributions rendering pages.

title: .:en:Make content indexable by search engines.
body:
.:en
Content indexability is a remaining issue. Actually, we would probably have many organic search users by now, if not for the lack of this feature.

title: .:en:Sum all hours across hierarchy, at the top view.
body:
.:en
Right now, the hours displayed are the ones directly associated with the item. However, at the top view, it would make sense to display totals.

In general, it would make sense to display totals everywhere, as summed downstream from that level, where the item is. However, that will require periodic jobs pre-computing that, because it will get computationally hard.

title: .:en:Add a checkbox, to avoid notifying the comment after its edit.
body:
.:en
Currently, users are notified of every edit of the comment, but it shoud not always  do so. The author should have the ability to avoid notifying the user about the comment edit.

title: .:en:Time declaring does not work for topics, works only for comments.
body:
.:en
Time declaring and time accounting is only available for comments, it does not work for topics. Make declaring time on the topic actually create a comment with that corresponding time, because that would actually make expected behavior, as described [here](https://infty.xyz/#/topic/864/comment/769).

Just test topic :)

Doing some work {1.5}. Also declare:

.:lt
In fact, a related area from which we could get some insights, is [program runtime](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Run_time_(program_lifecycle_phase)) measurement. A related [talk](https://www.imf.org/en/News/Seminars/Conferences/2018/04/06/6th-statistics-forum?playlistVideoId=5970016510001) about current state of world economics. What's interesting, is the idea of "economic scenario generator". However, the scenarios that they talk about, is probably just buy-sell trends, which then weights (prioritizes) tasks, as described in my [post on AI control](https://blog.mindey.com/2016/06/25/staying-in-control-of-ai/).

.:en
So, guys, looked like the comments were not entirely correctly ordered. Will updated this this evening, as per [this](https://infty.xyz/#/en/@/topic/884) task :) It's always great to see people start actually trying out the system.

.:en
> and in case i pick to store the data off-chain, where do you store it?

Right now, we're using BigChain DB to store a copy of the comment or topic in question. Otherwhise, it is stored simply on our PostgreSQL. I'm considering us moving to Hyperledger Fabric, or Corda, or Ethereum-like chains. For now, it is quite much in testing phase, but the data is being backed up, and will be preserved, and always moved to new data storage types, as the system evolves.

.:en
[Andrej.Ruckij@33A5520C], For the un-initiated, it simply works like a forum about goals, ideas, etc.  The general rule is that we must share global goals, not local. Also, ideas must be some new methods or principle (at least new to the author), and not special cases.

I had a [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zV9nfz2BA6M) before, about the general idea, of how it works. I would recommend to view it. Overall, the system is still not entirely mature, but increasingly getting closer to it.

[Niamhnab@7208D522]:

> Did people explain why they dropped off?

Maybe because the users originally came around 2015, and there was a completely different user experience? Actually, this system relaunched just a few days ago. So, I'm not sure what to expect yet. 

> I think this is all very complicated at present. If it could be presented in a more simple way...
> also putting time in curly brackets in the OP didn't work …

The putting of time to curly braces only works for comments, not topics. I had noticed that, and created a [task](https://infty.xyz/#/en/@/topic/870) to address that.

> did you know that each time infinity notifies me of a response, it sends the notification twice?

Actually, it doesn't. I was just editing the comment twice, and currently, it sends the notification on every new edit. Ideally, it should probably leave user a choice, e.g., a checkbox, to avoid notifying the comment after its edit. Just like in Google Calendar, we have option to not notify the parties about the change of event, if the change is deemed not sufficiently significant by the author.

This is a problem in more than online lectures. It exists in classrooms around the world from primary school all the way up through college. Part of the problem is the way 'teachers' tend to be thought of as authority and leaders rather than supporters. Learning happens best through direct engagement with the thing being learned. Listening to someone talk about it is sometimes useful but it's heavily over-relied on in society's approach to education. The 'teacher' needs to be someone who supports the learning rather than a director of the learning. The learner should be assisted, guided and offered advice if they want it. This would also make the job of the educator more interesting and less pressured.

.:en
Someone who did this very well and without degrees in film-making was Agnes Varda, a Frenchwoman. She used what she had and what she had grew over time.

.:en
One thing about suicide is the taboo. If you can eradicate the taboo and shame around suicide, people are more likely to talk, to reach out for help. Knowing that people accept suicidality as a normal state makes a person less afraid or ashamed of connecting with others honestly. This connection in itself already reduces the risk of suicide. People tend to isolate themselves before killing themselves. We need to make suicide a normal topic and not have people hiding because they're feeling shit. We need them to connect, not disappear. 
And also, I would add that yes material issues are definitely a part of the suicide equation. People in poverty and people who experience massive losses suddenly, are all at higher risk depending on their support structures and their own psychological structure as well. E.g. during the Recession, suicides among certain demographics increased dramatically. People who'd been fairly wealthy and suddenly faced drastic losses were more likely to kill themselves. A huge shock to the system can cause suicidality in many people and that shock can be the grief of lost love, status disgrace or financial ruin. What's needed are ways to buffer against and absorb the shock. Some of these include solid social connections where honesty is safe. Sometimes, a chemical support such as a drug can buffer the shock in a short term sense but the person's autonomy needs to be able to resurface in order for full recovery.

.:en
[Hi@A517E17C] I think Patreon is potentially a good platform. There are also other things online. I'd love to see something that could plug in cross-platform. Have a logo like the Facebook logo that you can plaster into Youtube videos / description, into Tweets, FB posts, on website, on platforms like Patreon and that a person could click on to donate/support the artist. Another button beside it that brings you to the artist's shop (if on Shopify or FineArtAmerica or Patreon or own website or whatever). Or the two sub-buttons in one.

.:en
[Niamhnab@7208D522],  Niam! Welcome back to Infinity!

// screen everybody for structural defects of the heart

Very interesting. So, does is this screening procedure already exist? It would be interesting to know, what are the costs, and what are the **devices** being used to detect those holes in interchamber tissue? Maybe those devices are not that expensive, and every school could afford to get one and teach kids how to use it? (i.e., kids are fast learners, and considering that learning certain practical medical knowledge like reading ECG, doesn't require decades of medical school, but rather, requires just simple explanation what to look for, it is not unfathomable to imagine that certain procedures could be done by people themselves, given the availability of the devices).

.:en
My business offers this as a service. People dictate their 'writings' into e.g. their phone or a dictaphone/laptop/etc. I get the digital files (or in some cases, people have posted me the physical dictaphone itself) and transcribe them. Then I format the document to the person's preferences etc. It seems like something that a software could be developed for to do it all automatically. Having tried some voice-to-text softwares, I was dissatisfied with the results - lots of errors, no proper punctuation and it took me the same time and less frustration to just transcribe the files myself manually. There are improvements that could be made to the manual transcription process as well that would be very helpful and make the whole process a lot more efficient.

.:en
Recommend looking up Open Dialogue treatment for Schizophrenia, highly effective, developed in Lapland. Needs to be rolled out internationally.

.:en
This topic is close to my heart. 
An option might be to create humane conservation spaces where creatures are safeguarded and a life of less suffering is facilitated by means of human intervention in a benign way. One example that is along these lines is Big Cat Rescue in the US. There's a lot further we could go with this.

.:en

However, that's not a reason not to start building a system by which we can improve the movement of food and other resources towards people in need. Here's a little inspiration: https://food.cloud/

.:en
I think this is important. Unfortunately, I don't know how it would be done.

.:en
Another important thing to consider is the role of stress in stroke. Stress is very impactful on heatlh in various ways and it seems to be one thing that is too often overlooked. The lifestyle of a person can dramatically increase or decrease their likelihood of having strokes (and maybe other issues). When looking at reducing the worldwide risk of stroke, we need to be looking at people's stress levels, choices, self-worth (which can be very closely linked to stress levels and experiences of stress) and so on. Obviously, smoking is a huge factor in stroke and so should be discouraged. It might be worth looking at low risk smoking alternatives, although the vaping trend seems to be a wolf in sheep's clothing and does not necessarily meet the standard of 'low risk' as it currently uses many compounds of unknown biological effects.

.:en
One thing that would reduce stroke incidents would be to screen everybody for structural defects of the heart. In people with holes in interchamber tissue, risk of stroke increases hugely. It might sound unrelated but blood needs to flow in along a certain path and if there's a hole in the heart between different chambers, some blood can go in the wrong direction. This means that you could get clots that should be sent to the lungs to be filtered out being redirected straight up to the brain which can't deal with them effectively and this can result in an eschemic attack/stroke (TIA). If detected, these holes can be addressed with surgery. Whether or not the surgery would be better in childhood rather than adulthood is worth looking into. Alternatively, if the hole isn't very big, it can still carry a hefty stroke risk and this can be mitigated by preventative measure of taking blood thinners such as a low dose of aspirin.

.:lt
Tokių tendencijų jau galima stebėti ir dabar, kai nesveikas maistas yra padaromas skaniu, kai reklama naudojasi žmogaus instinktų sužadinimu ir emocijų koreliavimu su pirkimo sprendimais, tokiu būdu sukurdami rinką [limbinei sistemai](http://www.spauda.lt/science/brain-dec.htm), o ne [neocortex](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neocortex), kas veda prie neracionalios visuomenės. Could we achieve many of the goals by remotely using each other's bodies? We already have >15 billion hands, way more than robotic ones, and if we could transfer skills to each other by remotely controlling each other's bodies (by mass-produce muscle interfaces), we could do many things, including, e.g., surgery, remotely. E.g., look at [this experiment](http://vimeo.com/84150219).

I think, we need to run that database on a very reliable server, so it would make sense to ask for that kind of server from an existing education institution, or even someone from the U.N., rather than have it as our sole responsibility... Additionally, it doesn't have to be a single server of course, due to the distributed properties of MongoDB, it is easy to have it on many. However, to make it quickly available, I'll first point data.inf.li to my public wiki. {0.3}

What would such social conditionality mean? Technology is double-edge sword, does that mean, that the patent owners would be able to restrict the use of technology for certain ranges of purposes?

How would this relate to technology use by governments? Patents usually are not enforceable at government levels.

.:en
What would be the optimal structure of the private-public ownership for such condominium law, for addressing the global catastrophic risks?

.:en
While makes total sense, this assumes that the losses are net positive, and that we don't know who is going to be affected by the global catastrophic risks.

If they are net negative (e.g., practically everyone loses), or it is known in advance, that e.g., the locations near the sea are going to suffer most due to the rising sea level and global warming, I think, this would make this kind of insurance scheme harder to implement.

.:en
Very concrete. Would be interested in deeper analysis, how this new structure would affect overall ability to address the global risks.
